revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Artist Discography |Artist = [[Ashley Tisdale]] |Image = Ashley Tisdale in Scottsdale 1 cropped.png |Alt = A young blonde female singer on a stage sings into a microphone. |Image size = 200px |Caption = Tisdale performing at the opening for the first [[Microsoft Store]] in [[Scottsdale, Arizona]] |Studio = 2 |Studio link = Studio albums |EP = 2 |Singles = 7 |Singles link = Singles |Soundtrack = 22 |Music videos = 9 |MV link = Music videos |Video = 1 }} The [[discography]] of [[Ashley Tisdale]] consists of two [[studio albums]], two [[extended play]]s, seven [[Single (music)|singles]], one video album and nine [[music videos]]. Tisdale has also recorded a soundtrack album, six singles and several other releases as her ''[[High School Musical]]'' character [[List of characters from High School Musical (film series)#Sharpay Evans|Sharpay Evans]]. She became the first female artist to debut with two songs simultaneously on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] with the releases "What I've Been Looking For" and "Bop to the Top", as Sharpay Evans.{{cite web|title=Ashley Tisdale Biography| work=Billboard|url=http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/bio/index.jsp?pid=716922|accessdate=March 16, 2009}} Before signing a record deal with [[Warner Bros. Records]] in 2006, Tisdale recorded several tracks for [[DisneyMania|Disney compilation albums]], including a "[[Kiss the Girl]]" cover. Her debut album, ''[[Headstrong (Ashley Tisdale album)|Headstrong]]'', was released in February 2007 and reached number five on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], selling 64,000 copies in its first week.{{cite web|last=Hasty|first=Katie|title=Fall Out Boy Hits 'High' Note With No. 1 Debut|work=Billboard|date=February 14, 2007|url=http://www.billboard.com/bbcom/news/article_display.jsp?vnu_content_id=1003545534|accessdate=September 27, 2009}} "[[He Said She Said (song)|He Said She Said]]" is her only [[Music recording sales certification|certified single]] and Tisdale's most successful single in the US. Her second studio album, ''[[Guilty Pleasure (Ashley Tisdale album)|Guilty Pleasure]]'', was first released in June 2009 in several European countries, and was released in the US on July 28, 2009. The album debuted at number twelve on ''Billboard 200'', selling 25,000 copies in its first week in the US.{{cite web|last=Herrera|first=Monica|url=http://www.billboard.com/#/news/fabolous-tops-billboard-200-jackson-s-ones-1004000186.story|title=Fabolous Tops Billboard 200; Jackson's "Ones" Now 2009's Second-Best Seller|work=Billboard|date=August 5, 2009|accessdate=August 5, 2009}} "[[It's Alright, It's OK]]" is the lead single of ''Guilty Pleasure'' and became her most successful single worldwide, mainly in Europe, by entering in numerous charts and reaching a top-forty peak position in Germany, Austria, Finland, Sweden and more. ==Albums== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" border="1" |+ List of albums, with selected chart positions and certifications ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:16em;"| Album details ! scope="col" colspan="10"| Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| [[List of music recording certifications|Certifications]] |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:90%;"| [[Billboard 200|US]]
